results.title: The Tracker [DVD] (A)
results.creator_credit: Vertigo Productions, South Australian Film Corporation, Rolf De Heer and Julie Ryan
results.brief_description: Set in the Australian outback in 1922 and filmed on location in the Flinders Ranges, South Australia, “The Tracker” tells the story of three white men and an indigenous tracker in pursuit of a fugitive. The Tracker (David Gulpilil) is a native policeman during a time in which trackers were employed to find suspects. He answers to The Fanatic (Gary Sweet), a cruel bigot who is hell bent on catching The Fugitive, an aboriginal man accused of murdering a white woman. The Follower (Damon Gameau), is a naive young colonial policeman new to the job while The Veteran (Grant Page) is a world weary man whose kind nature is overridden by what he must do and how society expects him to treat blacks. The three white men are ultimately dependent on the silent, ever watchful tracker. When an interrogation of some bush blacks turns into a massacre, the balance of power shifts and assumed notions of truth and justice are thrown into question. While the film tackles the brutal treatment of Aborigines by white police, De Heer averts a realist portrayal of graphic violence by cutting to paintings (by South Australian artist, Peter Coad) that represent the scenes of brutality and bloodshed. With its sparse use of dialogue, but much of the film’s thematic content - about the displacement of Aboriginal peoples by white settlers, and conflict between white and indigenous systems of justice - is conveyed through songs written by Graham Tardif and performed for the film by indigenous musician, Archie Roach. David Gulpilil won an AFI Award for best actor for his role in the film. Written by Rolf de Heer ; cinematography by Ian Jones ; editing by Tania Nehme. Jointly commissioned by Adelaide Festival of the Arts 2002 and SBS Independent. Also available on VHS [317684].

results.title: The Track
results.creator_credit: Chapman Pictures, Hilton Cordell Productions, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Penny Chapman, Nick Greenaway, Michael Cordell and Victoria Pitt
results.brief_description: A 6 part series on the history of the Australian Racing Industry from the different points of view of the jockeys, trainers, bookies, callers, punters and politicians. Horse racing started in the 1700’s to give the developing colony something social and sporting to go to, and was a popular pastime, despite the ban on swearing, fighting, gambling and drinking, and has since developed into a huge industry. Each episode covers a period of time in racing history from 1788 to current racing, and includes interviews with trainers, jockeys and callers of the past. Footage of famous horses includes Phar Lap and Bernborough. Narrated by Tiriel Mora.

results.title: The Town mouse and the country mouse
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Kathleen Shannon and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: Evelyn Lambert’s well-known style of animation using paper figures and brightly coloured backgrounds, based on an Aesop fable. Tells the simple story of two mice with different lifestyles and suggests that it is far better to live simply and in peace than live in luxury amidst danger

results.title: The Touch
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman’s first English language film continues his investigation of the human psyche and contemporary existential anguish and alienation. Elliott Gould is an American archaeologist visting Sweden who is welcomed into the house of Andreas and Karin (Max Von Sydow and Bibi Andersson). The American falls in love with Karin and the ensuing relationship forces her to examine her beliefs regarding marriage, family and status. However, as her affair continues she is forced to re-evaluate what it is that has drawn her to the American. Their relationship is frustrated by the insecurities and silences of people unable to find ways of communicating desire and truth. As in all his films, Bergman’s “The Touch” is part of an imtimate cinematic exploration: intense, controversial and painfully honest. Bergman’s remarkable ouvre is one of cinema’s most outstanding pleasures and the cinematography is by his longtime collaborator, Sven Nykvist.

results.title: The Top few inches
results.brief_description: Depicts impact of farming on the soils of Canada from the 1930s to the present. Shows soil erosion caused by poor farming techniques as well as leaching and salting due to irrigation. Emphasizes new practice of zero tillage and presents solutions to soil and land management.

results.title: The Tool users
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Jack Kaufman Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that humans are not the only animal that has developed the ability to fashion and use tools. Shows a variety of animals using tools in their daily routine. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen.

results.title: The Tonight Show
results.brief_description: The “Tonight Show” is an interactive ‘late night’ show set in the year 2040 on Coode Island. The robotic host ‘Cyborg” is the host of the show, asking each user to make their selection from a menu of ‘items’ to compile the show. The content for each section (listed in a menu) offers musical interludes, comedy segments and interviews in traditional late night format which the user can mix and match to create their own late night program. This interactive cleverly and subtlely comments on environmental issues and the formulaic nature of late night television. Kids will love the robotic host and guest stars (NOTE there are 2 versions of this work - G rated for general exhibition and the original version featuring mild drug references and swearing)

results.title: The Tomten
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Paul R. Gagne
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Tomten, a magical being of Swedish legend, which lives in the corner of a hayloft on a lonely old farm. The Tomten creeps around the farm, speaking Tomten, “a silent little language”, that animals can understand, while lamenting the fact that the people are asleep and cannot talk to him. Based on a poem by Victor Rydberg, adapted by Astrid Lindgren, illustrated by Harold Wiberg.

results.title: The Tom Jones special
results.brief_description: This compilation of video clips, performances and appearances of the pop icon, Tom Jones, is a must for fans of the singer. The film commences with Tom Jones in the UK with great shots of the Thames, as Tom sings all the old favourites. There is also a great selection of special appearances from The Carpenters, Raquel Welsh, Engelbert Humperdink, Kirk Douglas, Charlton Heston and Rudolf Nureyev. Fascinating footage spanning Tom Jones’ glittering career provides great entertainment for all devotees of this sex icon.

results.title: The Tobacco problem: what do you think?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Stanley Croner and Kent Smith
results.brief_description: Points out the dangers of smoking by presenting interviews and demonstrations by laboratory scientists and doctors. Emphasises the reasons why people smoke, and includes debate by teenagers on the pros and cons of smoking.
